content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)' without any additional text.

Premises: [(1) Every rompus is shy. (2) Every shumpus is a numpus. (3) Rompuses are grimpuses. (4) Tumpuses are not opaque. (5) Tumpuses are zumpuses. (6) Jompuses are spicy. (7) Jompuses are vumpuses. (8) Each lorpus is an impus. (9) Each grimpus is fast. (10) Every lorpus is a tumpus. (11) Every numpus is bright. (12) Shumpuses are snowy. (13) Impuses are temperate. (14) Tumpuses are shumpuses. (15) Shumpuses are brimpuses. (16) Every rompus is a lorpus. (17) Every zumpus is not large. (18) Every lorpus is red. (19) Stella is a rompus. (20) Stella is a jompus.] Prove: (21) Stella is snowy.

Premises: [(1) if Stella is snowy then Taylor is a visionary. (2) Every rompus is shy. (3) Every shumpus is a numpus. (4) Rompuses are grimpuses. (5) Tumpuses are not opaque. (6) Tumpuses are zumpuses. (7) Jompuses are spicy. (8) Jompuses are vumpuses. (9) Each lorpus is an impus. (10) Each grimpus is fast. (11) Every lorpus is a tumpus. (12) Every numpus is bright. (13) Shumpuses are snowy. (14) Impuses are temperate. (15) Tumpuses are shumpuses. (16) Shumpuses are brimpuses. (17) Every rompus is a lorpus. (18) Every zumpus is not large. (19) Every lorpus is red. (20) Stella is a rompus. (21) Stella is a jompus.] Prove: (22) Taylor is a visionary.
